column4: When I click "Save to X Configuration file" it says, Failed to parse existing X config file '/etc/X11/xorg.conf'! How do I fix this?
When I click "Save to X Configuration file" it says, Failed to parse existing X config file '/etc/X11/xorg.conf'! How do I fix this?
move your current /etc/X11/xorg.conf* files to a safe location, then run "sudo nvidia-xconfig" then rerun the nvidia-settings and it should save
there will be an xorg.conf but there may also be an xorg.conf.backup or similar
Where should I move them, im new so i dont know what a safe location would be
your home directory would be a good spot - would you like the terminal command to do it?
YES - but instead of using /home use ~ which will map to the correct /home/yourusername
should it echo anything back to me?
not if it was successful -- so no
ok I did it, now how do I fix that parsing error again?
on command line - no news is good news
sudo nvidia-xconfig first
then "gksu nvidia-settings" and try to save
Ok now how do I restart x server so  I can complete this?
no not really - did the save work?
I think so how do I check?
It didnt error it just asked me where i wanted to save and whatn ot
did you get the "failed to parse" error?
nope
then it should have worked :)  I'd make the changes/settings you want, resave, then reboot to test
It says it needs a restart to X server to finish, do I restart my computer?
might be the easiest thing to do (really i believe you only need to restart Xorg)
